Class Permutation

java.lang.Object
Permutation
public class Permutation extends Object
The Permutation class holds methods that handle the calculation of permutations.
Author:
Rachel Hussmann

  • Method Details

    • getPermutation

      public int getPermutation(int n, int r)
      The getPermutation method uses the Permutation formula and integers to calculate the number of groups that are possible.
      Parameters:
      n - The size of the set to choose from.
      r - The number of choices to be made from the set.
      Returns:
      The total number of groups that can be made from n and r as an integer.

    • getPermutation

      public BigInteger getPermutation(BigInteger n, BigInteger r)
      The getPermutation method uses the Permutation formula and BigInteger objects to calculate the number of groups that are possible.
      Parameters:
      n - The size of the set to choose from.
      r - The number of choices to be made from the set.
      Returns:
      The total number of groups that can be made from n and r as a BigInteger object.

    • testerOutput

      public void testerOutput()
      The testerOutput method is used to test the methods that have been developed in this class.
